TopicTitle: Do you think Squad should leave the Round8 Toroidal Tank alone?

Articles.Content:
> 
> As far as i can see, most people would be happy with a round8 xenon-veriant besides the LFO-Version
>  That's no completely new model, that's just a new texture.
> 
> And even the texture does not need to be completely new, just the gold/orange-part needs to be changed to silver. 
> 
> Tell me if i'm wrong, but shouldn't be that be roughly as hard as using photoshop for selective color correction on a simple jpeg?

Check last link in my signature.

> 
> Check last link in my signature.

Can't see the images right now, is the color changed?

More important: How long did it take to make this?
I think [**this**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115763) would be a better solution generally speaking. You could have toroidal tanks for anything.
Looks like the general feeling of the community is pretty clear.
well, I can't vote on this (I'm assuming because I'm new) but I do support saving it the way it is. and why not add another round tank for xenon?

Im against keeping the round8 as LFO, but with poll result and the massive backlash in the form of this thread, half the forum users avatars being changed, some changed sigs, and Im sure some reddit stuff, how has Squad not addressed this yet? Is there no one running damage control on this, or any form of PR?

> 
> Im against keeping the round8 as LFO, but with poll result and the massive backlash in the form of this thread, half the forum users avatars being changed, some changed sigs, and Im sure some reddit stuff, how has Squad not addressed this yet? Is there no one running damage control on this, or any form of PR?

My guess is it will come up in the next dev notes.

*edit*: You know. This could have all been avoided if Max would have just posted on the Orbiter forums, asking what they thought of a possibly change to the round 8.

I want to thank everyone for their support on this. While I am overjoyed that everyone was so enthusiastic about saving the wonderful Round-8 tank, this thread resides in the Suggestions forum and now that we know the thread was a success, it is merely waste of space that some other wonderful idea could be occupying.
